div.p: Diagnostics for a Web Site are enabled on the Configure management page for the Web Site. After configuring diagnostics for a Web Site the resulting log files can be downloaded from the FTP site listed under the Diagnostics Logs section of the Dashboard management page.

Connect to the FTP site listed under Diagnostics Logs to access the log files saved per logging options set on the Configure management page. Authenticate to the FTP site with your deployment user account credentials. This account is listed under Deployment User on the Dashboard management page. If the words Not set appear under Deployment User then you must create the deployment user account before you can authenticate to the FTP site where the diagnostic logs are stored.

tr.td: When you connect to the FTP host for a Web Site on Web Sites to deploy content or access diagnostic logs, prepend the username with the name of the Web Site followed by a backslash. For example to authenticate the deployment user “testuser” to connect to the FTP host for the Web Site “testweb” you would specify the username as “testweb\testuser” (without the quotes).

Consider using an FTP client such as FileZilla to download diagnostic logs. An FTP client should provide usability superior to a web browser for specifying credentials, viewing folders and downloading files from FTP sites.
